title: Strobe Talbott
added: * Talbott, Strobe. ''The great experiment : the story of ancient empires, modern states, and the quest for a global nation'' (2009) [https://archive.org/details/greatexperiments0000talb online]
* Talbott, Strobe. ''Endgame : the inside story of SALT II'' (1980) [https://archive.org/details/endgameinsidesto0000talb online]

title: Strobe Talbott
deleted: The former [[Foreign Intelligence Service (Russia)|Russian Foreign Intelligence Service]] (SVR) operative [[Sergei Tretyakov (intelligence officer)|Sergei Tretyakov]] said that SVR considered Talbott a source of intelligence information and classified him as "a special unofficial contact," even though "he was not a Russian spy."<ref name="ReferenceA">[[Pete Earley]] ''Comrade J'', Putnam Adult, January 24, 2008</ref> The allegations center on Talbott's relationship with Russia's ambassador to Canada, [[Georgiy Mamedov]], who was a longtime SVR "co-optee," according to Tretyakov. Mamedov called the allegations "blatant lies."<ref name="ReferenceA"/> Talbott also rejected the accusations, calling them "erroneous and/or misleading in several fundamental aspects..."<ref>{{cite news |first=Jeff |last=Stein |title=Top U.N. Nuclear Watchdog a Russian Spy, Defector Says in New Book |url=http://www.cqpolitics.com/wmspage.cfm?parm1=5&docID=hsnews-000002657689 |publisher=Congressional Quarterly |date=2008-01-19 |access-date=2008-01-31 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20080120192549/http://www.cqpolitics.com/wmspage.cfm?parm1=5&docID=hsnews-000002657689 |archive-date = 2008-01-20}}</ref> and said that his meetings with Mamedov advanced US objectives, such as getting Russia to accept [[NATO]] enlargement and helping to end the [[Kosovo War]].<ref name="ReferenceA"/>
